Tom Emerson wrote:
> Gordon Mohr (Internet Archive) writes:
> 
>>Another thought from Igor here that could explain the extra '.open'
>>files: have you launched multiple crawls pointing to the same 'arcs'
>>directory absolute path? (Each crawl could be responsible for up
>>to 5...)
> 
> 
> Nope, whenever I run multiple crawls on a machine I have completely
> separate ARC directories, and also define different prefixes for each
> crawl.

I've made two bugs from your report:

[ 1190439 ] too many .open ARCs after (low disk?) errors
http://sourceforge.net/tracker/index.php?func=detail&aid=1190439&group_id=73833&atid=539099

[ 1189825 ] ARC problem causing .invalid suffix needs better reporting
http://sourceforge.net/tracker/index.php?func=detail&aid=1189825&group_id=73833&atid=539099

Separately, if you are crawling on a machine where 'df' is available,
you can add a LowDiskPauseProcessor to your crawls. It regularly checks
a given set of mounts for sufficient free space. If the amount of free
space gets too low, the crawl will be paused, giving you a chance to
clear space before proceeding.

- Gordon @ IA
